social.friends

Class FriendsMenu

  • java.lang.Object
    • social.friends.FriendsMenu

  • public class FriendsMenu
extends java.lang.Object
    The FriendsMenu class interacts with the user on the My Friends Page
    Version:
    1.3 07 Apr 2020
    Author:
    Wa Thone

        Displays the My Friends Page, input choices, and prompt

      • displayFriendsOrRequests

        public void displayFriendsOrRequests(java.util.List<User> friendsOrRequests,
                                     int start_index,
                                     java.lang.String listType)
        Displays the specified List of User objects of either friends or friend requests, specified by the list type, with the first index of the list starting from specified start_index
        Parameters:
        friendsOrRequests - the List of User objects of friends or friend requests
        start_index - the starting index of the list
        listType - the list type, either 'Friends' or 'Requests'

      • unfriendFriend

        public void unfriendFriend(java.lang.String input)
        Checks if the specified input for user's choice of friend is valid. If valid, unfriends the friend chosen.
        Parameters:
        input - the input of user's choice specifying the friend, format U

      • sendFriendRequest

        public void sendFriendRequest(java.util.Scanner sc)
        Takes in user's input as the username of a user to send friend request to. If valid username, friend request is sent to that user.
        Parameters:
        sc - the scanner that takes in user's input

      • acceptFriendRequest

        public void acceptFriendRequest(java.lang.String input)
        Checks if the specified input for user's choice of friend request is valid. If valid, the friend request is accepted
        Parameters:
        input - the input of user's choice specifying the friend request, format A

      • rejectFriendRequest

        public void rejectFriendRequest(java.lang.String input)
        Checks if the specified input for user's choice of friend request is valid. If valid, the friend request is rejected
        Parameters:
        input - the input of user's choice specifying the friend request, format R

      • viewFriend

        public char viewFriend(java.lang.String input)
        Checks if the specified input for user's choice of friend friend is valid. If valid, directs user to that Friend's Wall Page.
        Parameters:
        input - the input of user's choice specifying the friend, format V
        Returns:
        'M' when the user chooses to go back to Main Menu from Friend's Wall Page, 'V' if error

      • checkValidFriendRange

        public boolean checkValidFriendRange(java.lang.String input)
        Checks that the input's index is within the range of numbers shown for friend list
        Parameters:
        input - the input of user's choice specifying the friend, format
        Returns:
        true if input's index is within valid range for friends, false otherwise.

      • checkValidFriendRequestRange

        public boolean checkValidFriendRequestRange(java.lang.String input)
        Checks that the input's index is within the range of numbers shown for friend request list
        Parameters:
        input - the input of user's choice specifying the friend request, format
        Returns:
        true if input's index is within valid range for requests, false otherwise.

      • checkValidRange

        public boolean checkValidRange(java.lang.String input,
                               int start_index,
                               int end_index)
        Checks that the input's index is within the range of specified start index and end index
        Parameters:
        input - the input of user's choice, format
        start_index - the minimum value that the index can take to be valid
        end_index - the maximum value that the index can take to be valid
        Returns:
        true if index is within the range specified, false otherwise.

      • getListSize

        public int getListSize(java.util.List<User> arrayList)
        Gets the size of the specified list
        Parameters:
        arrayList - the List of String to find size of
        Returns:
        0 if list is null, otherwise, the size of the list

      • getUserByInput

        public User getUserByInput(java.lang.String input)
        Gets the selected User by the specified user's input
        Parameters:
        input - the input of user's choice, format
        Returns:
        the User object corresponding to the specified input's index
